I keep getting mental characteristics and personality mixed up
Obviously one is what someone knows and what skills they have, while the other is how they act. But sometimes there is overlap.
Is kindness a mental characteristic or a personality trait? A person can act kind, but they can also be naturally inclinded to be kind.
I'd say mindset.
So Mental characteristic.
Theres "being kind"andthen theres "being peceived as kind"
The right oneis more of a skill than the left
just find a way o word that. "Charismatic
or somethin
New Deviantart Post: Gone Fishing https://www.deviantart.com/twokinds/art/Gone-Fishing-790160670
eh, i'd put kindness as personality trait, because you usually only perceive people as kind when they actually do/say kind stuff
Could be a sociopath though. Someone who literally "acts" kind in order to been seen as such and gain their trust.
well, then you'd put something like "his kindness is just an act" or something as personality.
imo i would put anything that is about how a person beahves/acts towards other as personality, whereas "characteristics" would be more passive stuff
someone having a good memory or being good at math would be a mental characteristic, while being brash/violent/kind would be personality.

How deep a cut you think it needs to be before you need stitches
:ptv-shock:
I stepped on a chunk of glass

Generally anything longer than 3/4 an inch I'd say. Also anything that is close to a major joint that is in constant motion like on the knee or elbow may want stitches. You may also take into consideration the depth. Those cuts that reveal internal
It’s one of my toes
structures like muscle or fat because the entire dermal layer is compromised may need stitches.
Sorta at the end joint
You should absolutely get it looked at

That's something that I'd go by depth. Was it an inch long shard that impaled your toe, or was it just a sharp chunk that scratched it.
